ground_truth: Evelyn is wearing jeans that are lathered white on the inside of the thighs and laced with brown horsehair, as well as riding boots, and despite perspiring a little, she looks younger than she did in the office. Gittes is a little taken aback at seeing Evelyn as the Chinese Butler appears on the veranda, nods, and disappears. Evelyn sits at a glass-topped table, and Gittes joins her. The iced tea comes on a tray which Ramon sets down between them. Evelyn looks up, and Gittes smiles a little sheepishly and then laughs a little nervously, nodding. Gittes drives up a winding road, following a flood channel up into the parched hills, reaching the entrance to the reservoir where a rescue truck is parked. The chain link fence with its KEEP OUT sign is open, and there are people milling around. The reservoir is below, and Gittes' car is stopped by a couple of uniformed police. He fishes out one of Yelburton's cards from his handkerchief pocket and hands it to the guard, driving past through the gate along the reservoir. Gittes stops and gets out of the car, spotting a police car and an unmarked one, with several men with their backs turned, one talking quietly, staring down into the reservoir where other men in small skiffs are apparently dredging for something. One of the men turns and sees Gittes, visibly shocked, as Loach tries to ease him down the path, and at the sound of his raised voice, a man standing at the edge of the channel, talking to two boys in swimming trunks, turns around, resulting in both Gittes and Escobar registering considerable surprise at seeing one another. The men around them are extremely uneasy as they walk a couple of steps, with Gittes reaching into his pocket to pull out his cigarette case, to which Escobar nods and finally smiles. The other police, two plainclothesmen and a uniformed officer, watch them. Escobar points down to the reservoir where a couple of men using poles with hooks are fishing about in the water and manage to hook something, revealing the soaking back of a man's coat, then start to pull the body into the skiff, standing over the body of Mulwray. Escobar has the sheet drawn back, then drops it as Evelyn nods. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side and whisper, almost as though they were trying to keep the corpse from hearing them, then move slowly toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar but doesn't know how to answer him, and Escobar nods while Gittes has been sitting on a wooden bench, smoking and listening.

From his handkerchief pocket, one of Yelburton's cards is fished out by him and handed to the guard, then through the gate along the reservoir he drives past. Extremely uneasy, the men around them are as a couple of steps are walked by Gittes, reaching into his pocket to pull out his cigarette case, which is nodded at by Escobar, who finally smiles. They are watched by the other police, two plainclothesmen and a uniformed officer. Down to the reservoir, Escobar points, where a couple of men using poles with hooks are fishing about in the water and manage to hook something, revealing the soaking back of a man's coat, then start to pull the body into the skiff, standing over the body of Mulwray. The sheet is drawn back by Escobar, then dropped as Evelyn nods. They move a few feet to one side and whisper as if trying to keep the corpse from hearing them, then slowly move toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar, unsure how to answer him, and Escobar nods while on a wooden bench, smoking and listening, Gittes has been sitting.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Evelyn wears jeans lathered white on the inner thighs, laced with brown horsehair, and riding boots. Despite perspiring, she looks younger than in the office. Gittes is surprised to see Evelyn as the Chinese Butler nods and leaves. Evelyn sits at a glass-topped table, joined by Gittes. Ramon sets iced tea between them. Evelyn looks up, and Gittes smiles sheepishly, then laughs nervously. Gittes drives up a winding road to the reservoir entrance, where a rescue truck is parked. The chain link fence with a KEEP OUT sign is open, and people mill around. Gittes' car is stopped by uniformed police. He shows Yelburton's card and drives through the gate. Gittes exits the car, spotting police cars and men dredging the reservoir. One man sees Gittes, shocked, as Loach tries to calm him. A man talking to two boys turns, surprising Gittes and Escobar. The men are uneasy as Gittes pulls out a cigarette case, and Escobar nods and smiles. Other police watch. Escobar points to the reservoir where men hook a man's coat, pulling Mulwray's body into a skiff. Escobar uncovers the body, then covers it as Evelyn nods. Escobar and Evelyn whisper, then move toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar, unsure how to respond, as Escobar nods. Gittes sits on a bench, smoking and listening.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Evelyn is dressed in a pair of jeans that are distinctly lathered white on the inside of the thighs, and they are intricately laced with strands of brown horsehair. She is also wearing sturdy riding boots, and despite the fact that she is perspiring slightly, she appears noticeably younger than she did when she was in the office. Gittes is somewhat taken aback upon seeing Evelyn, just as the Chinese Butler makes an appearance on the veranda, gives a nod, and then quietly disappears. Evelyn takes a seat at a glass-topped table, and Gittes joins her there. The iced tea is brought on a tray, which Ramon carefully sets down between them. Evelyn looks up, and Gittes offers a slightly sheepish smile, followed by a nervous laugh, nodding in acknowledgment.

Gittes drives up a winding road, following a flood channel that leads up into the dry, parched hills, eventually reaching the entrance to the reservoir where a rescue truck is parked. The chain link fence, prominently displaying a KEEP OUT sign, is open, and there are people milling around the area. The reservoir lies below, and Gittes' car is stopped by a couple of uniformed police officers. He retrieves one of Yelburton's cards from his handkerchief pocket and hands it to the guard, allowing him to drive past through the gate along the reservoir. Gittes comes to a stop and gets out of the car, noticing a police car and an unmarked vehicle, with several men standing with their backs turned. One man is speaking quietly, staring down into the reservoir where other men in small skiffs appear to be dredging for something. One of the men turns and sees Gittes, visibly shocked, as Loach attempts to ease him down the path. At the sound of his raised voice, a man standing at the edge of the channel, conversing with two boys in swimming trunks, turns around, resulting in both Gittes and Escobar registering considerable surprise at seeing one another. The men around them are extremely uneasy as they take a couple of steps, with Gittes reaching into his pocket to pull out his cigarette case, to which Escobar nods and finally smiles. The other police officers, including two plainclothesmen and a uniformed officer, watch them closely. Escobar points down to the reservoir where a couple of men using poles with hooks are fishing about in the water and manage to hook something, revealing the soaking back of a man's coat. They then start to pull the body into the skiff, standing over the body of Mulwray. Escobar has the sheet drawn back, then drops it as Evelyn nods. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side and whisper, almost as though they were trying to keep the corpse from hearing them, then move slowly toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar but doesn't know how to answer him, and Escobar nods while Gittes has been sitting on a wooden bench, smoking and listening intently.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Evelyn is dressed in a pair of well-fitted jeans that are distinctly lathered in a striking white shade on the inside of the thighs. These jeans are intricately interwoven with strands of brown horsehair, giving them a unique and textured appearance. She is also wearing a pair of sturdy, reliable riding boots, and even though she is perspiring slightly, she seems to appear noticeably younger and more vibrant than she did when she was last seen at the office. Gittes is somewhat taken aback and surprised upon seeing Evelyn, just at the moment when the Chinese Butler makes a discreet appearance on the veranda. He gives a polite nod and then quietly and swiftly disappears from view. Evelyn gracefully takes a seat at a glass-topped table, and Gittes proceeds to join her there. The iced tea is brought out on an elegant tray, which Ramon carefully sets down between them with precision. Evelyn looks up, and Gittes offers a slightly sheepish smile, which is followed by a nervous laugh and a nod in acknowledgment. 

Gittes drives up a winding road, following a flood channel that meanders up into the dry, parched hills, eventually reaching the entrance to the reservoir where a rescue truck is parked. The chain link fence, prominently displaying a bold and clear KEEP OUT sign, is open, and there are people milling around the area, appearing busy and alert. The reservoir lies below, and Gittes' car is stopped by a couple of uniformed police officers, who are vigilant and attentive. He retrieves one of Yelburton's cards from his handkerchief pocket and hands it to the guard, allowing him to drive past through the gate along the reservoir. Gittes comes to a stop, parks, and gets out of the car, noticing a police car and an unmarked vehicle. Several men are standing with their backs turned. One man is speaking quietly, his gaze fixed down into the reservoir where other men in small skiffs appear to be dredging for something of interest. One of the men turns and sees Gittes, visibly shocked, as Loach attempts to ease him down the path. At the sound of his raised voice, a man standing at the edge of the channel, engaged in conversation with two boys who are dressed in swimming trunks, turns around, resulting in both Gittes and Escobar registering considerable surprise at the unexpected sight of one another. The men around them are extremely uneasy and apprehensive as they take a couple of tentative steps, with Gittes reaching into his pocket to pull out his cigarette case. Escobar nods and finally breaks into a smile. The other police officers, including two plainclothesmen and a uniformed officer, watch them closely and with interest. Escobar points down to the reservoir where a couple of men using poles with hooks are diligently fishing about in the water and manage to hook something significant, revealing the soaking back of a man's coat. They then start to pull the body into the skiff, standing over the body of Mulwray. Escobar has the sheet drawn back, then drops it abruptly as Evelyn nods in acknowledgment. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side and whisper to each other, almost as though they were trying to keep the corpse from overhearing their conversation. They then move slowly toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar with uncertainty but doesn't know how to respond to him, and Escobar nods while Gittes, who has been sitting on a wooden bench, continues smoking and listening intently to everything that unfolds.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Evelyn is dressed in jeans that are distinctly lathered white on the inside of the thighs and intricately laced with strands of brown horsehair, paired with riding boots. Despite a slight sheen of perspiration on her skin, she appears noticeably younger than she did back in the office. Gittes experiences a moment of surprise upon seeing Evelyn, just as the Chinese Butler makes a brief appearance on the veranda, offering a nod before quietly disappearing from view. Evelyn gracefully takes a seat at a glass-topped table, and Gittes follows suit, joining her at the table. Shortly thereafter, a tray carrying iced tea is brought over by Ramon, who carefully sets it down between them. Evelyn lifts her gaze, prompting Gittes to respond with a slightly sheepish smile, which quickly evolves into a nervous laugh accompanied by a nod. Transitioning to a different scene, Gittes is now driving along a winding road, his path tracing a flood channel that leads him up into the arid hills. He eventually arrives at the entrance to the reservoir, where a rescue truck is conspicuously parked. The chain link fence, prominently displaying a KEEP OUT sign, stands open, and a number of people are milling about the area. Gittes' car is brought to a halt by a couple of uniformed police officers. He reaches into his handkerchief pocket, retrieves one of Yelburton's cards, and hands it to the guard, allowing him to drive past the gate and continue along the reservoir. Gittes brings his car to a stop and steps out, immediately noticing a police car and an unmarked vehicle nearby, with several men standing with their backs turned. One man is speaking quietly, all of them focused on the reservoir below, where other men in small skiffs appear to be dredging for something. One of the men turns around and spots Gittes, his expression visibly shocked, as Loach attempts to gently guide him down the path. The sound of his raised voice catches the attention of a man standing at the edge of the channel, who is engaged in conversation with two boys in swimming trunks. This man turns around, leading to a moment of mutual surprise between Gittes and Escobar as they recognize each other. The men surrounding them exhibit a palpable sense of unease as they take a couple of steps forward, with Gittes reaching into his pocket to retrieve his cigarette case, a gesture to which Escobar responds with a nod and eventually a smile. The other police officers, including two plainclothesmen and a uniformed officer, observe the interaction closely. Escobar gestures toward the reservoir, where a couple of men are using poles with hooks to fish around in the water. They manage to hook onto something, revealing the soaking back of a man's coat, and proceed to pull the body into the skiff, standing over the body of Mulwray. Escobar has the sheet drawn back to reveal the body, then lets it drop as Evelyn nods in acknowledgment. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side, engaging in a whispered conversation, almost as if they are trying to prevent the corpse from overhearing them, before slowly making their way toward the door. Evelyn glances at Escobar, uncertain of how to respond to him, while Escobar nods in understanding. Meanwhile, Gittes has been sitting on a wooden bench, quietly smoking and listening to the unfolding events.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Evelyn, dressed in jeans with white lather and brown horsehair, along with riding boots, appears younger despite perspiring slightly. Gittes is surprised to see her as the Chinese Butler briefly appears and disappears. They sit at a glass-topped table, and Ramon serves iced tea. Evelyn looks up, prompting Gittes to smile sheepishly and laugh nervously. 

Gittes drives up a winding road to the reservoir entrance, where a rescue truck is parked, and people are milling around. After showing Yelburton's card to the police, he drives through the gate and stops near the reservoir. He notices several men, including police, focused on the water where skiffs are dredging. One man, shocked to see Gittes, is eased down the path by Loach. Gittes and Escobar are surprised to see each other, causing unease among the men. Gittes takes out his cigarette case, and Escobar acknowledges with a nod and smile. 

Escobar points to the reservoir where men use poles to retrieve a body, revealing Mulwray's coat. Escobar uncovers the body, then covers it again as Evelyn nods. Escobar and Evelyn whisper aside, trying to keep their conversation private, then move toward the door. Evelyn, unsure how to respond to Escobar, looks at him as he nods. Meanwhile, Gittes sits on a bench, smoking and listening.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
Evelyn is wearing jeans that are lathered white on the inside of the thighs and laced with brown horsehair, suggesting she has just returned from horseback riding at Griffith Park, a popular equestrian spot in Los Angeles, as well as riding boots, and despite perspiring a little, she looks younger than she did in the office. Gittes is a little taken aback at seeing Evelyn as the Chinese Butler, a character often illustrating the racial diversity and complex social hierarchies of 1930s Los Angeles, appears on the veranda, nods, and disappears. Evelyn sits at a glass-topped table made by a renowned local artisan, and Gittes joins her. The iced tea, a staple refreshment in the Californian heat, comes on a tray which Ramon sets down between them. Evelyn looks up, and Gittes smiles a little sheepishly and then laughs a little nervously, nodding. 

Gittes drives up a winding road, following a flood channel constructed as part of Los Angeles's extensive water management system up into the parched hills, reaching the entrance to the reservoir, a critical component of the city's water supply, where a rescue truck is parked. The chain link fence with its KEEP OUT sign is open, and there are people milling around. The reservoir is below, and Gittes' car is stopped by a couple of uniformed police. He fishes out one of Yelburton's cards, which identifies him with the local water and power department, from his handkerchief pocket and hands it to the guard, driving past through the gate along the reservoir. Gittes stops and gets out of the car, spotting a police car and an unmarked one, indicating an official investigation, with several men with their backs turned, one talking quietly, staring down into the reservoir where other men in small skiffs are apparently dredging for something. One of the men turns and sees Gittes, visibly shocked, as Loach, a detective known for his brusque manner, tries to ease him down the path, and at the sound of his raised voice, a man standing at the edge of the channel, talking to two boys in swimming trunks, a common sight given the proximity to the city, turns around, resulting in both Gittes and Escobar, a seasoned detective with a keen eye for detail, registering considerable surprise at seeing one another. The men around them are extremely uneasy as they walk a couple of steps, with Gittes reaching into his pocket to pull out his cigarette case, to which Escobar nods and finally smiles. The other police, two plainclothesmen and a uniformed officer known for their diligence, watch them. Escobar points down to the reservoir where a couple of men using poles with hooks are fishing about in the water and manage to hook something, revealing the soaking back of a man's coat, indicating they have found a body, then start to pull the body into the skiff, standing over the body of Mulwray, a prominent figure in the city's water management controversy. Escobar has the sheet drawn back, then drops it as Evelyn nods. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side and whisper, almost as though they were trying to keep the corpse from hearing them, then move slowly toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar but doesn't know how to answer him, and Escobar nods while Gittes has been sitting on a wooden bench, smoking and listening, reflecting on the complexities unfolding around him.

Gittes is a little taken aback at seeing Evelyn as the Chinese Butler appears on the veranda nods and disappears. Evelyn sits at a glasstopped table and Gittes joins her. The iced tea comes on a tray which Ramon sets down between them. Evelyn looks up and Gittes smiles a little sheepishly and then laughs a little nervously nodding. Escobar points down to the reservoir where a couple of men using poles with hooks are fishing about in the water and manage to hook something revealing the soaking back of a man's coat then start to pull the body into the skiff standing over the body of Mulwray. Escobar has the sheet drawn back then drops it as Evelyn nods. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side and whisper almost as though they were trying to keep the corpse from hearing them then move slowly toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar but does not know how to answer him and Escobar nods while Gittes has been sitting on a wooden bench smoking and listening.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Evelyn is wearing jeans that are lathered white on the inside of the thighs and laced with brown horsehair as well as riding boots and despite perspiring a little she looks younger than she did in the office. Gittes is a little taken aback at seeing Evelyn as the Chinese Butler appears on the veranda nods and disappears. Escobar and Evelyn move a few feet to one side and whisper almost as though they were trying to keep the corpse from hearing them then move slowly toward the door. Evelyn looks at Escobar but does not know how to answer him and Escobar nods while Gittes has been sitting on a wooden bench smoking and listening.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Prudence is sporting overalls that are tinted green on the outside of the knees and threaded with blue peacock feathers, as well as hiking sandals, and despite shivering slightly, she appears older than she did at the bakery. Mortimer is a bit startled at noticing Prudence as the Brazilian Mechanic emerges on the patio, salutes, and vanishes. Prudence perches on a metal-framed couch, and Mortimer ambles over to her. The lemonade arrives on a platter that Horace places down beside them. Prudence glances down, and Mortimer smirks a bit awkwardly and then chuckles a bit apprehensively, saluting. Mortimer pedals up a twisting path, trailing a rain pipe down into the damp valleys, arriving at the entrance to the waterfall where an ambulance is stationed. The wooden gate with its WELCOME sign is shut, and there are animals wandering around. The waterfall is above, and Mortimer's bike is halted by a pair of armored soldiers. He pulls out one of Anderson's tickets from his vest pocket and hands it to the sentry, cycling past through the arch along the waterfall. Mortimer halts and climbs off the bike, noting a fire truck and a camouflaged one, with several women with their fronts turned, one speaking loudly, gazing up into the waterfall where other women in large canoes are seemingly searching for something. One of the women turns and spots Mortimer, visibly startled, as Baxter attempts to guide him up the trail, and at the noise of her hushed words, a woman positioned at the rim of the pipe, conversing with two girls in raincoats, pivots, resulting in both Mortimer and Sandoval acknowledging considerable astonishment at seeing each other. The women nearby are extremely relaxed as they shuffle a few strides, with Mortimer reaching into his bag to pull out his bubblegum tin, to which Sandoval acknowledges and eventually grins. The other soldiers, two undercover agents and an armored guard, observe them. Sandoval gestures up to the waterfall where a pair of women using nets with magnets are combing around in the air and manage to snare something, revealing the dripping top of a woman's hat, then begin to lift the figure into the canoe, overlooking the figure of Dubois. Sandoval has the curtain pulled forward, then releases it as Prudence acknowledges. Sandoval and Prudence shift a few inches to the other side and murmur, nearly as if they were endeavoring to prevent the statue from seeing them, then shift leisurely toward the window. Prudence stares at Sandoval but can't determine how to respond, and Sandoval acknowledges while Mortimer has been reclining on a plastic stool, chewing and observing.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Evelyn, wearing riding gear, sits with Gittes at a table, receiving iced tea from a butler. Gittes later drives to a reservoir, encountering police at an open gate with a KEEP OUT sign. Presenting a card, he proceeds to the site where police are dredging. Gittes' arrival surprises a man, Escobar, as they recognize each other. Amidst uneasy police, Gittes takes out his cigarette case, prompting a nod and smile from Escobar. They observe as the police pull a body, identified as Mulwray, from the water. Escobar and Evelyn whisper aside, avoiding disturbing the corpse, while Gittes listens, smoking on a bench.
